citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***The female caracal appears to be obese, the zoo manager believes the caracal may be pregnant but has not
communicated the caracal's condition to the attending veterinarian. Conversation with the attending veterinarian
confirmed that she was not made aware of the caracal's condition. Daily observations may be conducted by persons other
than the attending veterinarian provided that problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the
attending veterinarian in a timely manner.
The caracal shall be examined and appropriate guidance provided according to her nutritional needs. Observations
concerning animal health and well-being shall be communicated to the attending veterinarian in a timely manner.
Correct by October 30, 2024.

***The current shelter provided for the Patagonian Cavy is insufficient to protect the animals from impending inclement
weather. Although additional bedding has been provided for the animals the current shelter is open on two sides which
cannot block the wind. The local temperatures are dropping below 40 degrees Fahrenheit at night and the animals will
require additional protection from the wind and cold. Inadequate protection from the weather may cause discomfort and
illness.
Natural or artificial shelter appropriate to the local climatic conditions for the species concerned shall be provided for all
animals kept outdoors to afford them protection and to prevent discomfort to such animals
Correct by October 18, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Zoo Manager.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***The female caracal appears to be obese, the zoo manager believes the caracal may be pregnant but has not 
communicated the caracal's condition to the attending veterinarian. Conversation with the attending veterinarian 
confirmed that she was not made aware of the caracal's condition. Daily observations may be conducted by persons other 
than the attending veterinarian provided that problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the 
attending veterinarian in a timely manner.  
 
The caracal shall be examined and appropriate guidance provided according to her nutritional needs. Observations 
concerning animal health and well-being shall be communicated to the attending veterinarian in a timely manner. 
 
Correct by October 30, 2024. 
3.127(b) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
***The current shelter provided for the Patagonian Cavy is insufficient to protect the animals from impending inclement 
weather. Although additional bedding has been provided for the animals the current shelter is open on two sides which 
cannot block the wind. The local temperatures are dropping below 40 degrees Fahrenheit at night and the animals will 
require additional protection from the wind and cold. Inadequate protection from the weather may cause discomfort and 
illness. 
 
Natural or artificial shelter appropriate to the local climatic conditions for the species concerned shall be provided for all 
animals kept outdoors to afford them protection and to prevent discomfort to such animals 
 
Correct by October 18, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Zoo Manager.
